html: Starting as a computer in the segregated West Area Computing Division at @NASA_Langley, Mary Jackson worked her way to become @NASA’s first African-American female engineer. She also advocated for the hiring of more women in #STEM careers at NASA. #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/RTOMKEhj0w
text: Starting as a computer in the segregated West Area Computing Division at @NASA_Langley, Mary Jackson worked her way to become @NASA’s first African-American female engineer. She also advocated for the hiring of more women in #STEM careers at NASA. #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/RTOMKEhj0w

html: Dorothy Vaughan was the first African-American mathematician, human computer & first African-American female supervisor at @NASA_Langley. She taught herself & her staff FORTRAN so that they were prepared for the introduction of computers to their work! #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/Aw8hGMyaJe
text: Dorothy Vaughan was the first African-American mathematician, human computer & first African-American female supervisor at @NASA_Langley. She taught herself & her staff FORTRAN so that they were prepared for the introduction of computers to their work! #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/Aw8hGMyaJe

html: Working at @NASA_Langley calculating orbital mechanics, Katherine Johnson calculated the trajectories for @NASA’s first manned missions into space, including missions with Alan Shepard, John Glenn & the Apollo lunar landing. #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/5xRcLaBh9l
text: Working at @NASA_Langley calculating orbital mechanics, Katherine Johnson calculated the trajectories for @NASA’s first manned missions into space, including missions with Alan Shepard, John Glenn & the Apollo lunar landing. #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/5xRcLaBh9l

html: Today, for #PiDay and #WomensHistoryMonth, we celebrate 3 @NASA superstars whose work helped launch astronauts into space. Known as “Human Computers,” the stories of Katherine Johnson, Dorothy Vaughan and Mary Jackson were brought to the big screen in @HiddenFigures!

html: #OTD in 1874, Walter Moses Burton was elected to the Texas Senate. Born into slavery, he went on to be elected Fort Bend County Sheriff & Tax Collector after the Civil War. A champion of education, he was instrumental in the establishment of @PVAMU. #BlackHistoryMonth
text: #OTD in 1874, Walter Moses Burton was elected to the Texas Senate. Born into slavery, he went on to be elected Fort Bend County Sheriff & Tax Collector after the Civil War. A champion of education, he was instrumental in the establishment of @PVAMU. #BlackHistoryMonth

html: Today marks 77 years since President FDR signed Executive Order 9006, which led to the internment of nearly 120,000 Japanese Americans during WWII. On this Day of Remembrance for Japanese Internment, we remember this dark period in America, to ensure we will NEVER repeat it.
text: Today marks 77 years since President FDR signed Executive Order 9006, which led to the internment of nearly 120,000 Japanese Americans during WWII. On this Day of Remembrance for Japanese Internment, we remember this dark period in America, to ensure we will NEVER repeat it.

html: What a comeback?! Down 43-40, our @MarshallBuffs score a TD w/ 33 seconds. The Huntsville Hornets refused to lose but our men prevailed 47-43. WE ARE IN THE FINAL FOUR IN TEXAS 5A D2 - REGION 3 CHAMPS! Our poise, focus & “ refuse to lose” attitude did it. @MHS_Buffs @FortBendISD
